material.mattext:
Given:

fs = 11025;
tt = (0:round(0.25*fs))/fs;

Which MATLAB code would you use to generate the appropriate DTMF signal to represent telephone key number 5? And this is another way.
The meaning of "negative frequency" in a Fourier series is:
Negative frequencies represent those frequencies that, when measured from a plot, look like they are below ½fs.
A negative Fourier series component of a signal represents the imaginary part of the signal.

A negative Fourier series component represents a term in the Fourier series sum that has a negative value of frequency in the complex exponential. When it is added to a positive (absolute value) frequency component with the same amplitude, a real signal will result.
A negative frequency in the Fourier series represents the same signal component as the positive (absolute value) frequency, but with a negative amplitude.
Definition: A lowpass filter with magnitude response that supresses high frequencies of the input.

In signal processing, the purpose of the z-domain is to transform time-domain signals (x[n])
into another domain where signals can be representd by polynomials and systems can be
represented by rational functions. This transformation greatly simplifies signal manipulation
and filter design.

Given an 8-point complex bandpass filter with a peak magnitue of its frequency response at ω=½π?

Which coefficient is equal to -1?

The DSP-First CD contains several movies in Chapter 4 that illustrate the sampling process. One set is called "Aliasing and Folding" which can be found at "DSPFirst/chapters/4samplin/demos/aliasing/index.htm"
For this problem you need to watch the movie and then determine the spectrum of x[n] in the movie called "Aliasing" which is the FIRST movie in this set (screen shot shown below).
Since x[n] is a discrete-time sinusoid, its spectrum will contain an infinite number of lines in the omega-hat domain. Select the location of two of these omega-hat frequencies (in radians).

A transmitted message must also have a preamble and a termination to mark the beginning and end of the message. If the preamble bits are contained in the string row vector pre, the message bits in string row vector tt, and termination bits in string row vector mm.

Each string row vector is an array of characters ('0' or '1') in MATLAB, e.g., '0010110101110'.

Which of the following is the correct way to form the bit string sent out from modem?

Which of the following will produce seventy-one fours?
Mark ALL the correct solutions.
Given a system function H(z) = 1 - z<SUP> -1</SUP> + z<SUP> -3</SUP>, what is the frequency response of this system?
When <TT>z = -3 + j4</TT>, determine its angle in radians.

Since this Pre-Post-Lab will extend over several days and weeks, the Georgia Tech Honor Code requires you not discuss any aspect of these questions with other students until the last section has completed this exercise on Monday evening (22-Nov. at 6:00pm).
Check the box below to indicate you have read these rules, and that you agree to comply.

A student wishes to plot the magnitude of the frequency response of a digital bandpass filter H(z) when given the filter's impulse response, hh. Which of the following procedures will achieve the desired plot. Pick the BEST answer.
Among the following statements about the frequency response of a digital HIGHPASS IIR filter, pick the correct (or BEST) one:
The stopband is formed by placing poles on the unit circle.
The stopband is formed by placing zeros at z = 0.
The stopband is formed by placing zeros near z = 1.
The stopband is formed by placing zeros near z = -1.
The stopband is formed by placing complex-conjugate pole pairs close to the unit circle, but inside.

Since this Pre-Post-Lab will extend over several days, the Georgia Tech Honor Code requires that you not discuss any aspect of these questions with other students until the last section has completed this exercise on Monday evening (6-Feb at 6:00pm).
Check the box below to indicate you have read these rules, and that you agree to comply.
Which of following pole/zero characteristics would be used to create a Highpass filter?
Place a pair of conjugate poles at radius = 1.0 with angles of 75 and -75 degrees.
Place a pair of conjugate zeros at radius = 1.0 with angles of 75 and -75 degrees.
Place a pair of conjugate poles at radius = 0.75 with angles of 75 and -75 degrees.
Place a pair of conjugate zeros at radius = 0.75 with angles of 75 and -75 degrees.
Place a pair of conjugate poles at radius = 1.75 with angles of 75 and -75 degrees.
Place a pair of conjugate zeros at radius = 1.75 with angles of 75 and -75 degrees.
Place a pole at radius = 1.0 with an angle of 0 degrees.
Place a zero at radius = 1.0 with an angle of 0 degrees.

** TIME LIMIT **

You have a hard time limit for this on-Line Exercise. After the time expires, you will NOT BE ABLE TO SAVE ANY MORE ANSWERS.
Whenever you complete an answer, hit the "Save Answer" button to update your answer in the WebCT record. When you are finished with all the questions, hit the "FINISH" button.

Check the button below to confirm that you understand these instructions

You can have MATLAB running while you answer these questions. This is open book and open notes test. But, it must be your own work. You are NOT allowed to discuss it with anyone else while answering these questions.

Check the button below to confirm that you understand these instructions
Below are five versions of a function that is supposed to square an input (vector) argument and return the result. Only one of the functions works correctly, which one is it?
